title: Panicking when adding a unexpected keyword in a struct

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
```
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'Forcing query with already existing DepNode.
- query-key: ParamEnvAnd { param_env: ParamEnv { caller_bounds: [], reveal: UserFacing }, value: std::sys_common::wtf8::Wtf8Buf }
- dep-node: IsCopy(708c04bc555674a6-c5c3cb1bac3120ad)', librustc\ty\query\plumbing.rs:531:9

9  |         let command = Command::new(self.name)

[Error - 3:17:01 PM] Request textDocument/formatting failed.

thread 'request-worker-1' panicked at 'explicit panic', C:\Users\appveyor\.cargo\registry\src\github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823\rustc-ap-rustc_errors-218.0.0\diagnostic_builder.rs:295:13

note: rustc 1.30.0-nightly (33b923fd4 2018-08-18) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

```

The code:
```rust
use std::process::Command;

pub struct Binary {
    name: &'static str,
    command: Command,
}
```

Simply add the `mut ` keyword to the `command: Command,` line and it is panicking.
